CatDescriptText: Mr. Daniel Small, magazine editor, Squirrel Hill and Miss D. Belmont, commercial photographer's helper, Crafton, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1960, pg. 37 with question: "Do you think the religious issue will play a major role in the selection of the Democratic party's nominee for the Presidency of the United States?" Mr. Daniel Small's answer reads: "I don't think so.  If the Democrats see that Kennedy is strong politically and on other issues, they probably will take a chance..."  Miss D. Belmont's answer reads: "I certainly do.  Many people, including me, feel that if a Catholic is elected, the 'Pope will come over'...This would be against the Constitution, because they put the church before the state..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Daniel Small wearing hat with dark stripe, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Sanders Flowers, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of D. Belmont wearing earrings and light colored long sleeved belted dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
